docstr:
`MOVE_ALLOC` — Move allocation from one object to another

### Description
`MOVE_ALLOC(FROM, TO)` moves the allocation from `FROM` to
`TO`.  `FROM` will become deallocated in the process.



### Syntax
`CALL MOVE_ALLOC(FROM, TO)`


### Arguments

     
, may be
of any type and kind. 

 | `TO`  | `ALLOCATABLE`, `INTENT(OUT)`, shall be
of the same type, kind and rank as `FROM`.






### Return value
None



### Example
```


program test_move_alloc

    integer, allocatable :: a(:), b(:)


    allocate(a(3))

    a = [ 1, 2, 3 ]

    call move_alloc(a, b)

    print *, allocated(a), allocated(b)

    print *, b

end program test_move_alloc

```

     

### Standard
Fortran 2003 and later



### Class
Pure subroutine
